fields.description: Since the migration from JIRA Hosted to Atlassian OnDemand, users have reported no login prompt.  When I try to clear the tokens, I get the attached message.
fields.summary: Can't clear login tokens

fields.description:
If a product doesn't have any more available licenses (or cannot connect), the Application Access selection boxes are disabled for every product.

*Workaround:*
* Add or Remove Groups manually
*- confluence-users to add Confluence Application Access
*- jira-users to add Jira Application Access

Examples:
1) 4 licenses are still available for confluence but it is impossible to select the option: 
!disabledAppAccess1.jpeg!

2) User has Confluence access but can't be removed using the box
!disabledAppAccess2.jpeg!
fields.summary: Application Access disabled when one product reached max licenses

fields.description:
It has been reported that OnDemand throws this error when viewing the application access page:

bq. Error communicating with Bamboo Unknown Content-Type: text/html
bq. Error communicating with Confluence Unknown Content-Type: text/html

h4. Steps to reproduce

Still unknown.

*Workaround*
This error should go away after a short time. If this error persists for more then 2 hours, please create a [Support Request|https://support.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Application access throws Unknown Content-Type: text/html

fields.description:
When a user tries to access the new user management system from OnDemand, they are redirected to

<ondemand url> /secure/admin/$userManagementFullUrl/users

which results in a 404 error
fields.summary: Attempting to access new user management results in a 404 error

fields.description:
On our lunatech.atlassian.net confluence on demand the basic macro add on is disabled. I cannot enabled it via the admin dashboard. 

I posted a question here https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/278689/on-demand-instance-basic-macro-disabled/279314 and I was asked to contact the support team, which I suppose is done through JIRA.
fields.summary: On demand instance: basic macro disabled

fields.description:
The Bitbucket link is duplicated and the Jira link that should take users back to the OnDemand Jira instance is missing.

The bug is already being tracked on private issues: [BB-9423|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-9423] and [BBC-636|https://sdog.jira.com/browse/BBC-636]
fields.summary: Bitbucket Navigation Link to Jira is missing

fields.description:
I am currently conducting a trial with the OnDemand Confluence instance. 

Our SOE is currently WinXp and IE8; in the environment the buttons along the top of the rich text editor are invisible making it unusable.

It does work properly on the same SOE with Chrome installed however this is not the standard, and not available for most users.

I have found references back to the same issues in around 2009 however they are flagged as resolved. It have tried compatibility mode and the result is the same.
fields.summary: Rich text editor not functional with IE8

fields.description: JIRA Timesheet Reports and Gadgets Plugin 2.6 was released on OnDemand.  When you look to the Add Ons when logged in you can see that the option is to use 2.6, but when we Manage out currently installed version of the plugin it lists as 2.4.  How do we update our version of the plugin to 2.6?
fields.summary: JIRA Timesheet Reports and Gadgets Plugin - New Version Not Showing

fields.description: Please bundle the [JIRA Hero plugin|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/42092] into a future version of JIRA Studio
fields.summary: Bundle the JIRA Hero Plugin into JIRA Studio

fields.description: Nos gustaría disponer de permisos para la edición del nombre de los usuarios registrados.
fields.summary: Nos gustaría poder modificar el nombre de los usuarios
Cannot log into OnDemand- Instance password error

fields.description: I created user al@clout.com and sent him his log in information. The system allows him to enter his username and password and then takes him to a System Dashboard. However, There is an alert that says "This dashboard does not contain any gadgets or you do not have permission to view them. Perhaps you need to login to see them." If you click the login button all it does is reload the same page. Please help.
fields.summary: I created a user and the user cannot log in

fields.description:
We are experiencing an bug in the greenhopper planning board, issues with resolution Open and status Ready for Development - or any other combination of status and resolution indicating the issues in not Done - are being displayed as fixed in the planning board.

Actual result
issue status see - issue-resolution.png
planning board issue status see - planning-issue-resolution.png

Expected result
When an issue is not Done, the planning board should look as it does in planning-issue-resolution-expected.png

This is a very annoying bug which causes our PO's to be frustrated since it's very misleading when our stakeholders are asking for a status update on a certain issue.

We have tried to find the bug within our own setup but without luck.

fields.description:
Quite often, support engineers are required to add the sysadmin account to defined groups in order to effectively troubleshoot or reproduce a reported issue. 

Its generally not feasible to immediately undo said changes for two reasons:

- The issue might continue for a period of time 
- Subsequent issues allow us to immediately jump on the instance to troubleshoot 

That being said, displaying the sysadmin account to the customer can result in friction as it raises questions and uncertainty. 

In closing, we should consider running a healthcheck automatically on each boot up for JIRA and Confluence to detect and reset sysadmin privileges accordingly.
fields.summary: Run automatic Healthcheck when booting AOD instance to remove sysadmin permissions from JIRA and Confluence

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a project selecting the Simple Issue Tracking project type
# Click on the avatar for that project.
#* This should give you three links: Project Summary, All open issues, My open issues

Simple Issue tracking workflows don't have an "open" status for issues. There is a warning symbol beside Open and if you click on Open, then hover over the warning symbol in the dropdown you get the message "Status 'Open' is not valid..." (see attached image for full text)

This link should probably search on status "To Do" for projects of Simple Issue Tracking type.

fields.description:
*Description*
Users can access Webdav if he belongs to group with exact name *administrators*:
# If user belongs to a group with the name as *administrators* and although this group *does not* have  *JIRA Administrators* global permission, he still can access Webdav.
# If the group that user belongs to has *JIRA Administrators* global permission but is not named as *administrators*, then, he can not access Webdav.

*Reproduce steps*
# Remove *administrators* group out of *JIRA Administrators* global permission.
# Log in with user account that belong to this group, then this user can access Webdav.
# Rename *administrators* group to *jira-system-administrators*. 
# Add *JIRA Administrators* global permission to this group.
# Log in with user account that belong to this group, then the user is unable to access Webdav.
# Rename the group back to *administrators*, then user can access Webdav.

*Expected result*
# Users belong to group that has  *JIRA Administrators* global permission can access to Webdav regardless the group name.
# Users belong to group with the name as *administrators* and this group *does not* have  *JIRA Administrators* global permission are not allowed to access Webdav.
fields.summary: Administration users are unable to access Webdav if they do not belong to administrators group

fields.description:
I marked this issue as Blocker as it essentially makes it impossible to work with the current version of JIRA OnDemand.

I've been away for a week and today when I tried to work on the current JIRA OnDemand I noticed that some of the transitions are missing -- namely, the ' Start Progress (4) ' transition from state Open to In Progress doesn't have a button on the issue page. There are two other transitions from that state ( Resolve Issue (5)  and Push Back (321) ) which do have their buttons present.

The symptoms:
I created an issue -- was in state New, as expected
I clicked the Open button so it transitioned to state Open, as expected
Now, there used to be a 'Start Progress' button which is now missing so my issues are stuck in the Open state.

The transition labels were not presented in a visible way in the new workflow editor but I moved them around and I can verify they're still there, both in the new and classic editor.

It's obviously configuration-dependant issue so I suppose you'll need to check my workflow but there is only one for all my projects so it should be obvious. I appreciate this bug report may lack some information so I'm more than happy to provide any information you may need. Please feel free to look at my private bugtracker for the purpose of debugging this issue.
fields.summary: A transition is missing

If you open an ISSUE using "Collector Issue" (using the same Reporter, into the SAME project) this Issues will be not show into Customer portal, but ONLY from JIRA.
The same beheaviur you have even if you open an Issue by mail

Issue create by mail or by collectors have the field "Customer request type" = $origin instead of the right one!

fields.description:
The problem started off with Lucid Chart macro not displaying a document that I had embedded into a confluence page. 

To investigate I went to the Manage Apps and attempted to disable and re-enable the Lucid app. Upon doing so, it threw an unhelpful error saying it could not enable the app. I then attempted to enable safe mode which left all apps in a disabled state, as expected. 

I finally came out of safe model expecting my previous configuration to be restored, however this was not the case. Instead, all apps now appearred to be permanently disabled. If I attempt to enable individual apps, I receive another unhelpful error:

This add-on failed to enable. Refer to the logs for more information.
fields.summary: Apps within Manage Apps screen all appear disabled.

fields.description: https://betalabs.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/zendesk/sharing
fields.summary: Broken Zendesk URL integration

fields.description:
Our notifications (mails) have stopped working as far as I can tell. I have checked the settings and used Notification Helper to make sure the workflow is correct. The notification helper gives me the right answer but no mails are sent to some or all developers (haven't fully tested). The only thing that results in a mail is the @ command in the comment section. I, as Projet owner, also get all notifications. 

This started happening a few weeks ago. We haven't done any changes to the project, but did add another one for testing purposes. 

I guess it's a silly error somewhere but it beats me :)
fields.summary: Notifications not working

fields.description:
I choose detail mode in the dashboard for my open issues. If I then change the progress status I get a view with the error message "No issues were found to match your search". The change takes effect though. 

 See attachments. 

By the way - hard to guess component...:)
fields.summary: Dialog crash in issues dashboard
save buton is not working after entering all the fields

fields.description:
Dear All,

I want to try Redmine Importer plugin on my trial ondemand website but I cannot install it from my user interface.

https://atp-leica-jira.atlassian.net

https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-redmine-plugin

Could you please install it on my area?
fields.summary: Redmine Importer

fields.description: I create a sprint (but don't launch it) and then put some tasks there (A,B,C for example). Then I close task A and after that I see only tasks B and C in the sprint. Afterwards I launch the sprint with two tasks, but after it's launched it contains the closed task A as well.
fields.summary: Already done issues are included in sprints launched after the issues are closed

fields.description:
Here an example:
I have one issue of type "Task".
Users may add a subtask to this issue of type "ShowStopper".
I´d like do filter all Tasks that does not have a subtask "Showstopper" with status "Open" associated with it.
There is a lot of plugins in Jira that extends JQL but it seems NONE of them are available do Jira OnDemand which is a shame.
I think this is a very important feature and it´s absolutely necessary.

In my point of view this is very basic and everybody that wants to use Jira OnDemand for serious will need this kind of JQL extension.

Am I the only one that is requesting an extension to the very simple JQL syntax bundled with core jira?
fields.summary: add-on or plugin in order to enhance JQL in Jira OnDemand

fields.description:
Although, Sara Singer is listed as a watcher, she does not receive emails to her email address when this issue is updated by other users.  Sara does receive emails to her email address when other issues are updated by other users. 


https://shopvisible.atlassian.net/browse/FED-145
fields.summary: Emails are not consistently getting delivered to JIRA users.

fields.description:
After the maintenance downtown today, I have the following problems with my Confluence OnDemand instance:

* The Sidebar is missing. Switching a space to the documentation theme, only brings back the old sidebar.
* The buttons, e.g. for creating a new page is missing. Creating a new page is only possible from the dashboard now.
fields.summary: Missing sidebar and buttons in Confluence

fields.description:
Since the upgrade on 2013-09-30 (icebat-prod.78.0), Confluence Gliffys with valid licenses are reporting they do not have a valid license, and therefore refuse to work.

Note that Gliffy in JIRA appears to be unaffected.

h4. Latest Update (2013-09-30 18:15 GMT+10)

We have rolled back the change that caused this bug. Please raise a [support request|https://support.atlassian.com] if you continue to experience any problems.
fields.summary: Gliffy in Confluence reports that it does not have a valid license when it actually does

fields.description:
The removal of no subscribed application on Application Access option panel will avoid mistakes and misunderstandings. 


!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/92406/Screen%20Shot%202013-05-20%20at%201.26.03%20PM.png!
fields.summary: Remove the Application Access option of applications that aren't subscribed by customer

fields.description:
As an administrator of an OnDemand instance, when I manage the application access of my users, I'm unable to see the column's name of the application that I'm checking the box when scrolling the page down. It would be a good idea to not have the name of the application anchored to the page.

See image below as an example:

!app_access.png!
fields.summary: Improve application access page

fields.description:
Hello,

We have a Zendesk connection active, which has an own user assigned, which is in the "users" group.
We have a number of developers in the "developers" group, which in turn are in the role Developers.

We are trying to restrict comments from not propagating to Zendesk by setting the "restricted to" field in comments to the role Developers, but the Zendesk ticket is still updated. Even if the Zendesk user is removed from the case's watch list, it still gets updated.

Is this working as intended?
It's creating quite a bit of confusion and uneccesary mails etc.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Zendesk connection seems to ignore the "directed to" setting in comments

fields.description: we has already used pie chart on confluence. but it not work after recently update.
fields.summary: Does not work Pie chart

fields.description:
* Any confluence page, invoke {chart} macro. Select any kind of chart. I've been using Created vs. resolved. 
* Enter parameters. I've used both JQL and saved filters
* Click Save to invoke preview

Result is endless spinner and network message

Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)
https://wisdev.atlassian.net/charts?filename=jfreechart-onetime-7255472468041309684.png
fields.summary: jFreeCharts cant be found on setting of {chart} ptions

fields.description:
I am uploading mp4 video files to the confluence pages as attachments and they fail about 40% of the time.  The rest of the time they are fine  and I can view them but this is a major problem because I am putting together a company tutorial for a new employee and they cannot learn everything because these videos are missing.  The files are not larger than the others so it is not a size limitation from what I can see.  

The most recent example is a file that is 31,131KB and it is a MP4 file and when I try to upload the attachment it says "Could not upload the file to Confluence. The server may be unavailable."  

See attached screen shot
fields.summary: 40% of MP4 files I try to upload fail

fields.description:
Refer to screenshots.
Would like to unhide occasionally hidden Application Navigation item in Confluence. It is not possible. No "Update" button appears.
fields.summary: Confluence: Cannot unhide item in Application Navigator Settings

fields.summary: Importing from BitBucket fails

fields.description:
We have a customer who was using an SSL certificate from Starfield (GoDaddy) from 2011, which worked fine with OnDemand. He's renewed it and it seems to use a different intermediate CA bundle (was {{sf_bundle.crt}} previously, is now {{sf_bundle-2.crt}}, from [here|http://certs.starfieldtech.com/repository]), and we're now getting "unable to find valid certification path to requested target" errors in JIRA.

Plenty of people use GoDaddy certificates, we should ensure these work with OnDemand.
fields.summary: Add Starfield (GoDaddy) CA to OnDemand keystore

fields.description:
there is "Tools -> Watch" sequence posted on the page while really there is no such menu item. "Watch" button is now standalone.
Need to fix and search and replace all other "Tools -> Watch" (or something like this) strings.
fields.summary: Incorrect instructions on how to watch for the maintenance page

fields.description:
Hello guys.

I'm trying to do a custom field for date. The only options that I have is Date Picker the problem is that this format use the DD/MMM/YYYY exm: 24/Sep/13.
They way that the customer needs it is DD/MM/YYYY as  24/09/13.
Is there a way to change this?
fields.summary: Date format

fields.description:
Our ondemand instance:

   https://foodient.atlassian.net/

has been down since yesterday morning (some 26 hours now).  We have no access to JIRA or Bamboo. 

We have been given your standard "down for maintenance" page (attached), but I have received neither notification before nor communication since to indicate what is going on.  It seem that OnDemand is generally available, so I assume the problem is instance-specific.  Furthermore, I assume the problem is technical rather than licence-based, since I cannot get in to the account administration pages.

Please can you urgently inform me of the nature of the problem and when it will be rectified.  This is blocking internal workflows and external client information sharing.  It is a serious problem for us.
fields.summary: https://foodient.atlassian.net/ "down for maintenance"

fields.description: Customer has Confluence OnDemand and requests to add JIRA OnDemand. Support facilitates this by requesting Product Advocates add it. However, once JIRA starts up, there is no automatic Application Access for the initial admin.  As a result, no one can use JIRA until support manually grants users or admins application access.
fields.summary: No Application Application access when JIRA is added to Confluence OnDemand

fields.description:
unable to export team calanders to outlook using export to icalander
can export events eg holidays but not jira issue with dates, eg custom fields start and issue due date. urgently required
fields.summary: unable to export jira issue dates

fields.description:
Hello,

We have noticed a bug in one of our requests (https://deezer.jira.com/browse/STDA-2390) where the attachment module is not displayed correctly (please see screenshot).
As far as I know, it hasn't happened in other requests but I still don't know what could be the reasons of this error and what I could do to fix it.

Thanks in advance.
Best,

Pauline
fields.summary: Error on attachment module

fields.description: I seem to be having a problem with the multimedia macro.  I've tried several ways of saving my video (.mp4, .mov) and when they are uploaded using the multimedia macro the browser hangs forever and never actually plays the video.  I noticed that whenever I click out the page, it seems to come up for a split second - no matter how long I waited for it to come up - so it looks to me like something is getting hung up?
fields.summary: Embedded Video is not working, seems to hang up

fields.description: As of this past weekend, I've started receiving duplicate email notifications when a comment is added to a Jira Issue. Specifically, I receive email notifications for past history that I've already been notified of.
fields.summary: Receiving duplicate email notifications

fields.description: In JIRA OnDemand, when you remove a user from the JIRA Users group, the user won't be able to access JIRA anymore. But the license account won't be free unless you remove the application access which is a manual work.
fields.summary: Removing a user from the JIRA Users group does not free a license account

fields.summary: Status view page issue
Could not upload the file to Confluence. The server may be unavailable. Adding mp4 files fails half the time

fields.description: i am using application stand alone.
fields.summary: i got bug .

fields.description: Customers can see when a user last accessed Jira, but if the user doesn't have access to Jira the login doesn't appear to be recorded. It would be great to have this function in OnDemand through the User Interface.
fields.summary: Ability to view last login for a OnDemand Confluence user that does not have access to Jira via the UI

fields.description:
[Enabling Logout Confirmation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Enabling+Logout+Confirmation] page says it's possible to configure JIRA to prompt users with/without a confirmation before logging them out. However, it doesn't work in OnDemand (logout confirmation is always enabled). There are outstanding issues about this being tracked at [JRA-34534|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-34534] and [AOD-6043|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-6043].

Not sure if we should mention the problem within the page, or remove it entirely.
fields.summary: 'Enabling Logout Confirmation' doc causes friction

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Since there is no similar function in other add ons, would be very helpful if Confluence Usage Tracking Plugin comes bundled with Confluence OnDemand.
fields.summary: Add Confluence Usage Tracking Plugin as bundled plugin.

fields.description: Since SVN  will be removed from Atlassian OnDemand platform on 15th Octoboer 2013, it would be beneficial to remove the backup time limitation, as users trialing SVN migration multiple times within 48 hours or within the same day sometimes.
fields.summary: Remove Backup Manager 48 hour restriction from SVN backup

fields.description: Currently Backup Manager plugin for Confluence, JIRA, FishEye OnDemand allows the user to create a backup once every 48 hours, but that's not included as a warning before the user clicks the button. As users might not be aware of this limitation and breaks any plans they have to take multiple backups.
fields.summary: Include a warning text in Backup Manager for the backup interval limit
